thread.title: Walmart Neighborhood Market to open in Hillsboro on New Year's Day (photos)
thread.title_full: Walmart Neighborhood Market to open in Hillsboro on New Year's Day (photos) | OregonLive.com

author: Jim Ryan | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Walmart Neighborhood Market to open in Hillsboro on New Year's Day (photos)
text:
Hillsboro's Walmart Neighborhood Market, which has been under construction since early summer, is scheduled to open on New Year's Day.
The market, located at the corner of Baseline and Cornelius Pass roads , is a smaller version of a Walmart Supercenter that carries groceries and other goods, store manager Kandice Ertman said.
It will join the ranks of other Walmart Neighborhood Markets in the greater metro area. The closest other such market is located in Tanasbourne .
Ertman said Walmart is hiring between 90 and 95 part- and full-time employees. People can apply for those jobs at a temporary hiring center at 135 N.E. 43rd Ave. in Hillsboro, at other Walmart stores or online , Ertman said.
The Hillsboro Argus/OregonLive has previously reported that the market will be 50,000 square feet and is part of a development dubbed "Sequoia Village." The development, according to the report , will also include two smaller retailers and 157 townhouses.
Ertman said she's excited to open the market and get to know the people of Hillsboro.
"That community feel is what we're looking for," she said.
